description: '''Francisco Hernández Mora''' (April 23, 1933 – February 11, 2005), better known as '''Pancho Quinto''', was a [[Cuba]]n [[Cuban rumba|rumba]] percussionist and teacher. He was the founder of [[Yoruba Andabo]] and one of the "godfathers" of the [[guarapachangueo]] style of Cuban rumba. His solo career began in the 1990s after he gained international attention through his collaborations with [[Jane Bunnett]] and other artists.
